metadata.title: Rules in Particle Physics
metadata.source: Particle Physics, Fourth Edition, B.R. Martin and G. Shaw

rules.title: Particle-content rule
rules.content: The Standard Model contains three kinds of fields, all taken to be point-like: (i) spin-1/2 matter fields (leptons and quarks); (ii) spin-1 gauge bosons {γ, W±, Z⁰, g} that mediate forces; (iii) one spin-0 Higgs boson H.

rules.title: Antiparticle rule
rules.content: Every relativistic charged field admits negative-energy solutions. Filling the Dirac sea predicts a distinct antiparticle of equal mass and opposite charge.

rules.title: QED vertex rule
rules.content: A valid electromagnetic vertex has one incoming and one outgoing fermion line with opposite arrow directions plus one photon. Electric charge, linear momentum and angular momentum are conserved at each vertex; diagrams that violate this (e.g. e⁻ → e⁺ + γ) are forbidden.

rules.title: Perturbative-order rule
rules.content: A Feynman diagram containing n QED vertices contributes an amplitude ∝ α^(n/2) and therefore a probability ∝ α^n, where α = e²/(4πε₀ℏc) ≈ 1/137. One-photon exchange (α²) dominates over two-photon exchange (α⁴), etc.

rules.title: Range-mass (Yukawa) rule
rules.content: Exchange of a boson of mass M_X produces V(r) = -g²/(4π) × e^(-r/R)/r, where R = ℏ/(M_X c). Thus massless exchange (M_X = 0) yields infinite range (EM, gluons); massive exchange gives a finite-range force (R ~ 10⁻³ fm for W±, Z⁰).

rules.title: Zero-range (Fermi) limit
rules.content: When |q²| ≪ M_X² c², M(q²) → -G_F, where G_F = √2 g²/(8M_X² c⁴), so the weak interaction reduces to a four-fermion point coupling.

rules.title: Natural-units rule
rules.content: Throughout we set ℏ = c = 1. Hence [M] = [E], [L] = [E]⁻¹, [G_F] = [E]⁻². Conversion back to SI uses ℏc = 197.3 MeV·fm.

rules.title: Lepton-family conservation
rules.content: With L_e = N(e⁻) - N(e⁺) + N(νₑ) - N(ν̄ₑ), and analogously for L_μ, L_τ, every Standard-Model reaction satisfies ΔL_e = ΔL_μ = ΔL_τ = 0.

rules.title: W± and Z⁰ vertices
rules.content: Charged-current vertices (e.g. W⁻ → e⁻ν̄ₑ) conserve the three lepton numbers; neutral-current (Z⁰) vertices carry zero lepton number.

rules.title: Four-fermion weak Lagrangian
rules.content: For |q| ≪ M_W, L_eff = -G_F/√2 (ψ̄₁ γ_μ(1-γ₅)ψ₂)(ψ̄₃ γ^μ(1-γ₅)ψ₄), where G_F = 1.166×10⁻⁵ GeV⁻².

rules.title: Universality of lepton weak interactions
rules.content: The weak coupling g_W (⇒ G_F) is identical for e,μ,τ. Consequently Γ(ℓ⁻ → e⁻ν̄ₑνₓ) = K G_F² m_ℓ⁵, and τ_τ/τ_μ = [B(τ→eν̄ν) / B(μ→eν̄ν)] (m_μ/m_τ)⁵.

rules.title: Neutrino vacuum oscillations
rules.content: For two-state mixing, P(νₐ→νβ) = sin²(2θᵢⱼ) sin²(Δm²ᵢⱼ L / 4E), where L₀ = 4E/Δm²ᵢⱼ.

rules.title: Matter (MSW) effects
rules.content: Propagation through matter with electron density N_e: Δm²ᵢⱼ → C Δm²ᵢⱼ, sin(2θᵢⱼ) → sin(2θᵢⱼ)/C, where C = √[(cos(2θᵢⱼ)-A)² + sin²(2θᵢⱼ)], A = ±2√2 G_F N_e E/Δm²ᵢⱼ (+ for ν, - for ν̄).

code_spec.template:
import math
A = {neutrino_sign} * 2 * math.sqrt(2) * {G_F_per_GeV2} * {N_e_per_cm3} * {E_GeV} / ({delta_m2_eV2} * 1e-18)
cos_2theta = math.cos(2 * {theta_rad})
sin_2theta = math.sin(2 * {theta_rad})
C = math.sqrt((cos_2theta - A)**2 + sin_2theta**2)
print(C)

rules.title: Observed oscillation parameters
rules.content: Global fits give Δm²₂₁ ≈ 7.5×10⁻⁵ eV², Δm²₃₂ ≈ 2.0×10⁻³ eV², sin²(2θ₁₃) ≈ 0.093.

rules.title: Suppression of charged-lepton flavour violation
rules.content: Loop-induced decays such as τ→μγ satisfy B(τ→μγ) ~ 10⁻⁴⁸-10⁻⁵⁰, utterly negligible relative to current bounds (<4.4×10⁻⁸).

rules.title: Quark generations
rules.content: Six flavours in three generations: (u,d), (c,s), (t,b) with charges +2/3 or -1/3 e; each quark carries baryon number B = 1/3.

rules.title: Minimal colour-singlet bound states
rules.content: In QCD the only colour-neutral combinations that must exist are baryons (qqq), antibaryons (q̄q̄q̄) and mesons (qq̄), all with integer electric charge and baryon numbers +1, -1, 0 respectively.

rules.title: Internal quantum numbers
rules.content: Define the flavour counters S = -N_s, C = +N_c, B̃ = -N_b, T = +N_t. Together with electric charge Q and baryon number B these label every hadron.

rules.title: Conservation-law hierarchy
rules.content: Strong/EM interactions conserve each quark flavour separately (B,Q,S,C,B̃,T). Weak interactions conserve only total B and Q; quark flavour may change.

rules.title: Associated production
rules.content: Because strangeness (or charm, bottom) is conserved by strong forces, strange quarks are produced in pairs so that the net S is zero (e.g. π⁻p → K⁰Λ with S: 0 0 → 1 -1).

rules.title: Lifetime bands
rules.content: Characteristic lifetimes cluster around τ_strong ~ 10⁻²⁴-10⁻²² s, τ_EM ~ 10⁻²¹-10⁻¹⁶ s, τ_weak ~ 10⁻¹³-10⁻⁷ s.

rules.title: Allowed vs. exotic quantum numbers
rules.content: (qqq) and (qq̄) restrict (Q,B,S,C,B̃,T). Any other set is exotic; no firmly established exotic hadron exists.

rules.title: Resonance width-lifetime rule
rules.content: A state of lifetime τ has Breit-Wigner width Γ = 1/τ.

rules.title: Centre-of-mass energy
rules.content: Fixed target: E_CM = √(m_b² c⁴ + m_t² c⁴ + 2m_t c² E_L). Collider: E_CM = 2E_L.

rules.title: Reaction rate and luminosity
rules.content: W_r = L σ_r, integrated luminosity L_I = ∫ L dt.

rules.title: Hadronic interaction lengths
rules.content: Collision length ℓ_c = 1/(n σ_tot); absorption length ℓ_a = 1/(n σ_inel).

rules.title: Ionisation loss (Bethe-Bloch)
rules.content: -dE/dx = D (q² n_e/β²) [ln(2m_e c² β² γ²/I) - β² - δ(γ)/2]. Minimum specific ionisation: (1/ρ)(dE/dx)_min ≈ 3.5 Z/A MeV g⁻¹cm².

code_spec.template:
import math
m_e_MeV = 0.511
K = 0.307  # MeV cm²/g
rho_factor = 1.0  # simplified
dE_dx = K * {Z} / {A} * (1/{beta}**2) * (0.5 * math.log(2 * m_e_MeV * {beta}**2 * {gamma}**2 * 1e6 / {I_eV}) - {beta}**2)
print(dE_dx)

rules.title: Radiative loss and radiation length
rules.content: -dE/dx = E/L_R with L_R⁻¹ = 4 Z(Z+1)α³ n_a ln(183 Z⁻¹/³)/m_e² c⁴. Hence E(x) = E₀ e^(-x/L_R).

code_spec.template:
import math
alpha = 1/137.0
m_e_GeV = 0.000511
N_A = 6.022e23
n_a = N_A * {rho_g_per_cm3} / {A}
L_R_inv = 4 * {Z} * ({Z} + 1) * alpha**3 * n_a * math.log(183 * {Z}**(-1/3)) / (m_e_GeV**2)
L_R = 1 / L_R_inv
E_after = {E0_GeV} * math.exp(-{x_cm} / L_R)
print(E_after)

rules.title: Photon attenuation and pair production
rules.content: I(x) = I₀ e^(-x/λ), σ_pair = (7/9) 1/(n_a L_R).

rules.title: Magnetic rigidity
rules.content: p [GeV/c] = 0.3 B [T] ρ [m].

rules.title: Translational invariance
rules.content: Spatial homogeneity ⇒ conservation of total momentum P = Σᵢ pᵢ.

rules.title: Rotational invariance
rules.content: With [Ĥ,J] = 0 the total angular momentum J = L + S is conserved.

rules.title: Parity P
rules.content: For a system with orbital L, P = (∏ᵢ Pᵢ)(-1)^L. Conventions: P_e⁻ = P_q = +1, P_γ = -1.

rules.title: Charge conjugation C
rules.content: For a neutral ff̄ pair: C = (-1)^(L+S). C_γ = -1.

rules.title: CP and J^PC labelling
rules.content: Strong/EM states can be classified by J^PC (e.g. π⁰: 0⁻⁺).

rules.title: Time reversal T and detailed balance
rules.content: T invariance ⇒ equal amplitudes for a+b ↔ c+d when spins and momenta are reversed.

rules.title: Positronium decays
rules.content: Parapositronium (C = +1) → 2γ; orthopositronium (C = -1) → 3γ; lifetime ratio τ₁¹S₀/τ₁³S₁ ≈ α.

rules.title: Isospin (flavour independence)
rules.content: Hypercharge Y = B + S + C + B̃ + T; I₃ = Q - Y/2. Light quarks form an isodoublet (u,d).

rules.title: Allowed meson and baryon multiplets
rules.content: For L = 0: two meson nonets (0⁻, 1⁻); baryon octet (1/2⁺) and decuplet (3/2⁺).

rules.title: Spin-symmetry rule for L=0 baryons
rules.content: Identical flavours must couple symmetrically in spin, giving the observed octet and decuplet patterns.

rules.title: Dirac-sum magnetic moments
rules.content: With L = 0, μ_B = Σᵢ eᵢ/2mᵢ.

rules.title: Hyperfine splitting
rules.content: ΔM = -κ Sᵢ·Sⱼ/(mᵢmⱼ); a single κ explains meson and baryon splittings.

rules.title: Colour confinement
rules.content: Only colour singlets (3q)^p(qq̄)^n observable; forbids free quarks and fractionally-charged objects.

rules.title: OZI suppression
rules.content: Decays requiring heavy QQ̄ annihilation/creation are strongly suppressed.

rules.title: Heavy-quark potential
rules.content: V(r) = -a/r + br with a ≈ 0.30, b ≈ 0.23 GeV² explains charmonium/bottomonium spectra.

rules.title: Radiative cascades in quarkonia
rules.content: Vector n³S₁ → (n-1)³Pⱼ + γ (E1); singlets via M1 or 2γ.

rules.title: Colour-charge universality
rules.content: Gluons couple only to colour: strong force is flavour-independent.

rules.title: Gluon self-interaction
rules.content: SU(3) gauge symmetry ⇒ three- and four-gluon vertices; basis of confinement and asymptotic freedom.

code_spec.template:
import math
beta0 = (33 - 2*{N_f}) / (6 * math.pi)
alpha_s = {alpha_s_mu0} / (1 + beta0 * {alpha_s_mu0} * math.log({mu_GeV}/{mu0_GeV}))
print(alpha_s)

rules.title: Two-jet angular rule
rules.content: In e⁺e⁻ → qq̄, dσ/d cos θ ∝ 1 + cos² θ confirming quark spin 1/2.

rules.title: Three-jet (gluon) rule
rules.content: Hard gluon emission gives three separated jets; angular distributions imply spin-1 gluon.

rules.title: Colour-counting for R
rules.content: R = σ(e⁺e⁻ → hadrons)/σ(e⁺e⁻ → μ⁺μ⁻) = N_C Σₐ eₐ²(1 + α_s/π + ...).

rules.title: Quark-gluon plasma criterion
rules.content: Lattice QCD: deconfinement above T_c ~ (150-200) MeV or ~ 5ρ_nuclear.

rules.title: Elastic form factors
rules.content: Proton: G_E(0) = 1, G_M(0) = μ_p; r_E² = -6 dG_E/dQ² |_{Q²=0}.

rules.title: Bjorken scaling variable
rules.content: x = Q²/(2Mν) in deep-inelastic scattering.

rules.title: Structure-function scaling
rules.content: At high Q², F₁,₂(x,Q²) ≈ F₁,₂(x).

rules.title: Callan-Gross relation
rules.content: Spin-1/2 partons ⇒ 2xF₁ = F₂.

rules.title: Parton distributions
rules.content: At Q² ~ 10 GeV² gluons carry slightly >50% of proton momentum.

rules.title: Scaling violation
rules.content: F₂(x,Q²) falls at large x, rises at small x with increasing Q².

rules.title: Charged-current neutrino rule
rules.content: σ_{ν(ν̄)N} ∝ G_F² E_ν at E_ν ≫ M.

rules.title: Quark-charge confirmation
rules.content: Combined ep and νp data verify e_u = +2e/3, e_d = -e/3.

rules.title: Drell-Yan rule
rules.content: qq̄ → ℓ⁺ℓ⁻ gives lepton pairs with d²σ/dM dy ∝ Σₐ eₐ² fₐ(x₁) f_ā(x₂)/(Ms).

rules.title: Jet-production rule
rules.content: Hard parton scattering ij → kl gives multi-jet spectra scaling as α_s^n.

rules.title: Current vs. constituent quarks
rules.content: Low-Q²: three constituent quarks; high-Q²: massless current quarks + gluons + sea.

rules.title: Charged-current universality
rules.content: All lepton doublets couple to W± with the same strength g_W.

rules.title: Lepton-quark symmetry
rules.content: Replacing (νₑ,e⁻) → (u,d), (νμ,μ⁻) → (c,s), (ντ,τ⁻) → (t,b) yields the W-quark vertices with couplings g_W V_{αβ}.

rules.title: Cabibbo mixing
rules.content: For two generations: d' = d cos θ_C + s sin θ_C, etc.; Cabibbo-suppressed amplitudes carry sin θ_C.

rules.title: CKM hierarchy
rules.content: Full 3-generation CKM matrix has small elements |V_{cb}| ~ 4×10⁻², |V_{ub}| ~ 4×10⁻³.

rules.title: W decay branching ratios
rules.content: Neglecting masses: Γ(W → qq̄') = 3Γ(W → eνₑ); B(W → hadrons) ≈ 2/3.

rules.title: Semileptonic strangeness rule
rules.content: Single-W exchange imposes ΔS = 0 or ΔS = ΔQ = ±1.

rules.title: Hadronic strangeness rule
rules.content: Two-W vertices allow ΔS = 0,±1 but forbid ΔS = ±2.

rules.title: b-quark lifetime
rules.content: Suppressed |V_{ub}|, |V_{cb}| give τ_b ≈ 10⁻¹² s.

rules.title: Top-quark decay
rules.content: t → bW⁺ almost exclusively; τ_t ≈ 4×10⁻²⁵ s ≪ hadronisation time.

rules.title: Neutral currents
rules.content: Z⁰ couples flavour-diagonally; no tree-level dsZ⁰ or ucZ⁰.

rules.title: Unification condition
rules.content: e = g_W sin θ_W = g_Z cos θ_W.

rules.title: Boson-mass relations
rules.content: M_W = M_Z cos θ_W; M_W² = πα/(√2 G_F sin² θ_W).

rules.title: Low-energy coupling ratio
rules.content: Four-fermion neutral-current strength: G_Z/G_F = sin² θ_W.

rules.title: e⁺e⁻ → μ⁺μ⁻ energy law
rules.content: σ ∝ α²/s at √s ≪ M_Z; near √s = M_Z Breit-Wigner resonance dominates.

rules.title: Higgs mechanism
rules.content: Scalar doublet with v ≠ 0 gives M_W = (1/2)g_W v, M_Z = (1/2)√(g_W² + g_Y²) v.

rules.title: Higgs-fermion couplings
rules.content: g_{Hff} = √2 m_f/v; H → bb̄ dominant at M_H = 125 GeV.

rules.title: Loop-induced Higgs decays
rules.content: H → gg (top loop) and H → γγ (top + W loops) important despite suppression.

rules.title: Higgs production
rules.content: e⁺e⁻: Higgs-strahlung near threshold, WW fusion at high energy. Hadron colliders: gg → H via top loop largest.

rules.title: Maximal parity violation
rules.content: Charged-current weak interactions couple only to L-handed fermions / R-handed antifermions.

rules.title: Charge-conjugation violation
rules.content: Weak amplitudes change under C (e.g. μ^± decay asymmetries).

rules.title: CP conservation in purely leptonic weak decays
rules.content: Observed to high precision: τ_{μ⁻} = τ_{μ⁺} etc.

rules.title: Chirality rule for neutrinos
rules.content: Only L-handed ν and R-handed ν̄ produced; opposite helicities suppressed by m²/E².

rules.title: Helicity suppression in π decay
rules.content: B(π⁺ → e⁺νₑ)/B(π⁺ → μ⁺νμ) = (mₑ/mμ)².

rules.title: Neutral-kaon mixing
rules.content: K_S (τ ≈ 0.09 ns) and K_L (τ ≈ 52 ns) nearly CP eigenstates.

rules.title: Indirect CP violation parameter ε
rules.content: |ε| = 2.23×10⁻³ from K_L → ππ.

rules.title: CPT theorem
rules.content: Local Lorentz-invariant QFT conserves CPT; masses and lifetimes of particles/antiparticles equal.

rules.title: Flavour oscillations as interferometers
rules.content: Δm_K = 3.48×10⁻¹² MeV, Δm_B = 3.34×10⁻¹⁰ MeV.

rules.title: B-meson CP violation
rules.content: In B⁰ → J/ψ K_S: sin 2β ≈ 0.68.

rules.title: Three manifestations of CP violation
rules.content: Mixing (|q/p| ≠ 1), decay (|Ā/A| ≠ 1), and interference (Im λ ≠ 0) observed in K,D,B.

rules.title: Grand-unification convergence
rules.content: Extrapolated couplings meet at M_X ~ 10¹⁵⁻¹⁶ GeV.

rules.title: Proton-decay inevitability
rules.content: X,Y gauge bosons mediate p → π⁰e⁺; τ_p > 10³⁴ yr.

rules.title: Charge quantisation
rules.content: GUT multiplets enforce ΣQᵢ = 0 within each family.

rules.title: Supersymmetry and the hierarchy
rules.content: TeV-scale sparticles cancel quadratic divergences in M_H.

rules.title: R-parity and a stable LSP
rules.content: R = (-1)^(3(B-L)+2S) conserved ⇒ neutral LSP WIMP candidate.

rules.title: WIMP relic density
rules.content: ⟨σv⟩ ~ 3×10⁻²⁶ cm³s⁻¹ ⇒ Ω_χ h² ≈ 0.1.

rules.title: Sakharov conditions
rules.content: Baryogenesis needs (i) B violation, (ii) C/CP violation, (iii) departure from equilibrium.

rules.title: Electric-dipole moments
rules.content: Current limits |d_n| < 3×10⁻²⁶ e cm, |d_e| < 9×10⁻²⁹ e cm constrain new CP phases.

rules.title: Axion solution to strong-CP puzzle
rules.content: Dynamical θ̄ → 0 gives light axion with 10⁹ < f_a < 10¹² GeV; dark-matter candidate.

rules.title: See-saw neutrino masses
rules.content: Mixing Dirac m_D with heavy Majorana M_R gives m_ν ≈ m_D²/M_R.

rules.title: Neutrinoless double-beta decay
rules.content: Observation (Z,A) → (Z+2,A) + 2e⁻ would establish Majorana neutrinos; present bound m_{ββ} ≲ 0.05 eV.

rules.title: Inflation
rules.content: Exponential expansion at t ~ 10⁻³⁵ s solves horizon and flatness problems; seeds near-scale-invariant CMB.

rules.title: Color charge conservation (SU(3)_C)
rules.content: Strong interactions conserve color charge: ∑ T^a = 0 for all QCD vertices. Quarks carry color (r,g,b), antiquarks carry anticolor (r̄,ḡ,b̄), gluons carry color-anticolor combinations.
rules.formula: ∑_quarks T^a_i = ∑_antiquarks T^a_j for each color index a = 1,2,...,8

rules.title: B-L conservation in electroweak theory
rules.content: Baryon number minus Lepton number (B-L) is conserved in Standard Model interactions. B-L violation may occur in GUT models or Majorana neutrino mass generation.
rules.formula: Δ(B-L) = 0 for SM processes; ∑_i (B_i - L_i)_initial = ∑_f (B_f - L_f)_final

rules.title: Hypercharge conservation (electroweak)
rules.content: Weak hypercharge Y = 2(Q - T₃) is conserved in electroweak interactions. Related to U(1)_Y gauge symmetry before electroweak symmetry breaking.
rules.formula: ∑ Y_i = constant; Y = 2(Q - T₃) where Q is electric charge, T₃ is weak isospin

rules.title: Strangeness conservation
rules.content: Strangeness S is conserved in strong and electromagnetic interactions but violated in weak interactions by ΔS = ±1 rule.

rules.title: Charm conservation
rules.content: Charm quantum number C is conserved in strong and electromagnetic interactions. Weak interactions allow ΔC = ±1 transitions.

rules.title: Bottom (beauty) conservation
rules.content: Bottom quantum number B' is conserved in strong and electromagnetic interactions. Weak interactions allow ΔB' = ±1 transitions.

rules.title: Top conservation
rules.content: Top quantum number T' would be conserved in strong and electromagnetic interactions, but top quark lifetime (τ ≈ 5×10⁻²⁵ s) is shorter than QCD hadronization time, preventing bound state formation.

rules.title: Isospin conservation
rules.content: Isospin I is approximately conserved in strong interactions (exact in isospin limit m_u = m_d). Electromagnetic and weak interactions violate isospin.

rules.title: G-parity conservation
rules.content: G-parity G = C·(-1)^I is conserved in strong interactions for systems without net quark number. Important for π-π scattering and ρ-meson decays.

rules.title: R-parity conservation (SUSY)
rules.content: R-parity R_p = (-1)^(3(B-L)+2S) is conserved in MSSM, ensuring lightest supersymmetric particle (LSP) stability and preventing rapid proton decay.

rules.title: Individual lepton number conservation
rules.content: Electron (L_e), muon (L_μ), and tau (L_τ) lepton numbers are separately conserved in Standard Model. Neutrino oscillations violate individual lepton number conservation.
rules.formula: ΔL_e = ΔL_μ = ΔL_τ = 0 (SM); violated by ν oscillations with Δm²_ij ≠ 0

rules.title: Chiral charge conservation
rules.content: Left-handed (L) and right-handed (R) fermion numbers are separately conserved in massless limit. Mass terms mix chiralities: ψ̄_L ψ_R + h.c.
rules.formula: ∂_μ j^5_μ = 2im ψ̄ γ⁵ ψ; j^5_μ = ψ̄ γ_μ γ⁵ ψ (axial current)
